textBox.richText: New member of the research staff

After working several years since 2010 as PostDoc and a Research Associate on face anti-spoofing, vein recognition and other topics in the Biometrics group, André has been hired as a permanent member of the research staff at Idiap. André will phase-out progressively from the biometrics group to develop new activites at Idiap. Congratulations to André ! André Anjos started studying electronics and computers in 1994, when he joined the Electronics Engineering School (http://www.del.ufrj.br) at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (http://www.ufrj.br). He obtained a Ph.D. in Signal Processing in 2006 with a work on High-Energy Physics Particle Detection using Neural Networks. In 2004, he joins CERN (http://www.cern.ch), Switzerland to work on the development and construction of the Trigger and Data Acquisition systems of the ATLAS Experiment. His domains of interest are pattern recognition and applied computing. You can follow this link to André's homepage (http://andreanjos.org) for more information, his CV and a complete list of publications.
André Anjos is now Member of Research Staff
